prompt.body: Put the ages in the right chronological order.
Put the developments in the right chronological order.

content.body: The emergence of the feudal system in government
The dutch Revolt that led to the beginnings of an independend Dutch state
Citizenship and scientific thinking in the Greek city-state
The beginning of nation states and centralization

prompt.body: Which characteristic is from the Age of cities and states?

content.body: The beginning of the European expansion
The chaning Renaissance view of the world and mankind
The rise of bourgeoisie and independend cities
The spread of Christianity throughout Europe

prompt.body: Who are the Spanish ancestors of Charles V?

Bernhard Strigel made this painting around 1515. It shows the Habsburgs Emperor Maximilian I with his son Philip the Fair, his wife Mary of Burgundy, his grandsons Ferdinand I and Charles V and Louis II of Hungary (husband of his granddaughter Mary of Austria).

Two men in this source are carrying a medal from the 'Order of the Golden Fleece'. Only the highest ranked (and best) Burgundian noblemen were allowed to wear this necklace. Where can you find both in the source? Who do you think are member of this elitist knight-club?
Make the right combinations between word and meaning.

content.body: A group of advisors who help the king to take decisions
a team of people who control the income and outcome of the king (from taxes)
A state where people feel united (for example by language, culture or religion)
A permanent army of mercenaries that the king could use whenever he needed it
Someone who works for the king or government
A meeting of representatives of the three estates or provinces, who came together to give the ruler advice.
The power executed by the king and his officals
Governing a region from a central place
Soldiers (sometimes foreign) who are paid, read: hired, to fight for an army

items.content: Read the key-words, try to find the meaning in the text.

content.body: Deputy of the sovereign ruler, responsible of the administration of the Low Countries
The assembly of the delegates from all the provinces in the Low Countries
Campaign by the provinces, nobles and cities to preserve their privileges and to be independend as possible
Meeting of the representatives of the clergy. nobility and cities in the province
The central point from which a region is governed
Process by whcih a region is increasingly governed from one place, and according the same set of rules
Special rights given to provinces, nobles or cities by the sovereign ruler
ruler over an area who is not a king, in the Low Countries the title of Charles V and Philip II

Complete the text:

Whereas in the had still been a collection of wealthy duchies, counties and dioceses in the Middle ages, this changed during the century. Through clever and war, the duke of burgundy began to gain control over large parts of the Low Countries. Since the , towns in the Low countries had grown relatively faster than those in neighbouring countries, with populations that earned their living in and . First to develop were those in Flanders. By the century the city of , in Brabant, had outstripped all the other towns of Flanders to become a leading centre of Europe. Towns in and also grew ever more important.

Are the next statements True (T) or False (F)?

T / F At the time of Charles V's rule, the Low Countries were unified.

T / F Rulers made separate agreements with each province about taxes.

T / F Each province took the decision to pay taxes to rhe ruler in the States-General.

T / F The States-Provincial, for example of Holland, was made up by representatives of nobles, clergy and citizens from the towns.

T / F The States-General would only agree to pay taxes, if the sovereign ruler granted privileges.

T / F The sovereign ruler was represented in the person of a deputy, like a governor or stadtholder.

T / F The stadtholder was ruling in the name of the sovereign at a province.

T / F The governor was responsible for the sovereign's policy in the Low Countries.
